page.title: 01A General description
page.content: The civil parish of Sutton is situated to the South East of the town of Macclesfield. It is a mixed settlement of mainly residential property ,much of which has been built since 1950,but also containing numerous farms.Many of these are still worked but some have become private dwellings.Industry exists in Langley in the form of silk screen printing and a heavy textile engineering factory. The civil parish of Sutton includes three main settlements. Sutton village being the largest,with Langley to the West and to the East, Lyme Green. The parish has a strong identity and there are facilities for social, religious and educational activities within its boundaries. Tegsnose Country Park and the edge of the Peak District are in the area.
